name: VideoRAG Core
fullName: VideoRAG Core Implementation - AI Vision Analytics Platform
description: Production-grade RAG-based video analysis platform with real-time multi-model processing, semantic querying, and containerized microservices architecture

phases.name: Phase 1: Onboarding & POC Knowledge Transfer
deliverables: Comprehensive deep-dive into existing POC codebase
Knowledge transfer from Fuelers technical team

phases.name: Phase 2: Stream & Ingestion Layer
deliverables: Ingestion Service deployment on Amazon ECS

phases.name: Phase 3: Analyzer Integration
deliverables: Model weights and inference endpoints setup

overview.problem: Industries need production-grade RAG-based video analysis at scale with real-time processing, semantic querying, and containerized deployment. Existing POC needs to transition to scalable, production-ready architecture
overview.valueProposition: Production-grade VideoRAG platform with containerized microservices, real-time video analysis through YOLO/BLIP/OCR models, semantic querying via Qdrant vector database, and RAG-based natural language Q&A
overview.strategicImportance: Transitions POC to production-ready system with containerization, establishes scalable architecture on AWS ECS, enables semantic video search and RAG-based querying for competitive market positioning

features.name: Video Stream Ingestion
features.description: Real-time frame capture from RTSP streams and video files

features.name: Multi-Model Analysis
features.description: YOLO detections, BLIP captions, and EasyOCR text extraction

features.name: Semantic Segmentation
features.description: Time-based video segments with metadata and summaries

features.name: Vector Search
features.description: Qdrant-powered semantic search across video content

features.name: RAG-Based Q&A
features.description: Natural language queries using retrieval-augmented generation

diagram.title: VideoRAG Microservices Architecture
diagram.description: Containerized pipeline from video ingestion to RAG-based semantic querying

team.note: Trilok Kaushik - Project oversight and coordination
Model support and optimization (provided by Fuelers)

software.note: AI models and APIs provided by Fuelers

costs.note: 8-week project timeline (target) with realistic 12-15 week delivery cycle for technical complexity

dependencies: Complete POC documentation and source code access (Week 1)
AI model weights and inference endpoints from Fuelers
OpenAI/Anthropic API keys and 100% uptime support
AWS infrastructure provisioning (ECS, S3, Kafka, Qdrant)
constraints: Dependent on full cooperation for POC knowledge transfer
Requires continuous AI/ML support from Fuelers
Multi-tenancy and RBAC excluded from Phase 1 (Phase 2 scope)
Building Map, Rule Engine, Notifications excluded from Phase 1

currentStatus.summary: Phase 1 in progress: Team onboarding and POC knowledge transfer underway. Geeksman Softwares team of 12 specialists working with Fuelers to transition POC to production-grade containerized architecture on AWS ECS. Target: 8 weeks delivery with realistic 12-15 week timeline for technical complexity.
achievements: Successful POC validation completed by Fuelers
Proven video ingestion from real IP cameras (RTSP/Files)
Established multi-model detection logic (YOLO, BLIP, OCR)

risks.risk: 8-week timeline aggressive for technical complexity - realistic delivery 12-15 weeks
risks.mitigation: Geeksman will accelerate development with full team effort, dependent on client's full cooperation on POC knowledge transfer and continuous AI/ML support. Weekly sign-offs and 24-hour resolution windows enforced.

risks.risk: POC knowledge transfer delays could impact timeline
risks.mitigation: Week 1 dedicated entirely to comprehensive knowledge transfer. Full cooperation required from Fuelers technical team with complete POC documentation and source code access.

risks.risk: AI model and API dependencies on Fuelers
risks.mitigation: Fuelers responsible for 100% uptime and technical support for all AI models and LLM APIs. Clear dependency documentation and SLA expectations.

risks.risk: Infrastructure costs and cloud resource availability
risks.mitigation: All AWS costs (ECS, S3, Kafka, Qdrant) borne directly by Fuelers. Infrastructure provisioning must be completed before respective phases.

risks.risk: Scope creep with Phase 2 features (Multi-tenancy, RBAC, Rule Engine)
risks.mitigation: Clear exclusion of Phase 2 features from current contract. Phase 2 requires separate mutual written agreement post Phase 1 completion.

planned: Complete Week 1: POC knowledge transfer and team onboarding
Weeks 2-3: Deploy Stream and Ingestion services on AWS ECS
Weeks 4-5: Integrate YOLO, BLIP, and EasyOCR analyzer services
Weeks 6-7: Implement Segment Service and Qdrant vector indexing
Week 8: Complete Chatbot API, Indexr Service, and final handover
Weekly sign-offs and progress reviews with Fuelers
Maintain 24-hour resolution window for all technical queries
boardAsks: Approval for AED 110,100 total project cost ($30,000 USD)
Advance payment of AED 36,700 ($10,000 USD) upon signing
Weekly installments of AED 9,175 ($2,500 USD) over 8 weeks
Commitment to 24-hour resolution window for technical queries
Weekly written sign-offs on deliverables and progress
Full POC documentation and source code access for Week 1
100% uptime guarantee for AI models and LLM APIs
AWS infrastructure budget approval (separate from development costs)
Decision on Phase 2 scope (Multi-tenancy, RBAC, Rule Engine, Building Map, Notifications)
Acceptance of realistic 12-15 week timeline vs. 8-week target
Non-solicitation agreement for Geeksman team (12 months post-project)

phase2Scope.note: Excluded from Phase 1 - Requires separate contract upon mutual written agreement

governance.weeklySignOff: Required at end of each work week
governance.aiSupport: 100% uptime and technical support from Fuelers

contractTerms.intellectualProperty: Full code rights transfer to Fuelers upon final payment
contractTerms.termination: 7 days written notice, compensation for work performed
